Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Pedroleeum
Reviews.Content: Having just arrived home yesterday after staying at the Alfa Hotel for 3 nights, I thought it only fair to write a positive review as both myself and the 2 friends I travelled with had a very enjoyable stay. The hotel itself was very clean, tidy and well run. The staff are all very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable - very useful for when we needed advice on how best to get around! The location of the hotel is a little far away from some of the main sights of Berlin (approximately a 45 minute walk to the Victory Column in the Tiergarten), however, we were recommended a 48-hour travel pass by the hotel staff (€15 each), for use on all public transport within the main areas of Berlin. This was absolutely fantastic and highly recommended to see the tourist attractions of Berlin, regardless of which hotel you stay at. Overall the hotel was very comfortable and made for a pleasantly memorable stay for the 3 nights we were there, just slightly too far to walk to the hotspots of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a short business trip”
Reviews.Author: enygmatys
Reviews.Content: I was visiting a company during my trip and just used the hotel to sleep because my main focus was work. The hotel was very close to the company and cheap and that is why our travel management chose that hotel. It was clean and the people were friendly. It is in an area that you would normally not go out because there is nothing to see and there are also not good restaurants around. If you want to go downtown then you have to take the bus but don't forget your bus plan because it is far from the centre and you will get lost.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for money”
Reviews.Author: JanDeanYorkUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alfa Hotel as part of a package booked through the My Berlin site. I chose the hotel as it seemed to be near the centre of town, but it is a little bit far from the centre. You have to get the TXL bus, and the stop is about 5 mins walk away. However, our receptionist told us about the transport ticket, which was 16 euros for 4 of us, and enabled us to have 24 hour travel on bus, Underground and trains! Very good value. We arrived late at the hotel due to flight delay, and had to get our keys out of a safe, a bit of a complicated procedure, but help was at hand on the end of the phone. The room we had was lovely, clean and spacious. The bathroom was very impressive too. Staff were very friendly and helpful, nothing was too much trouble. The buffet breakfast was very filling, with lots of choice of ham, boiled eggs, cheese, yoghurt and cereal. I would certainly go back again.

Reviews.Title: “It was just ok.”
Reviews.Author: aott02
Reviews.Content: Our plane was delayed and we got to the hotel at midnight. They close the front desk at 11pm and leave you a note saying that your key is in a box and you need to enter the code that was given to you in order to retrieve it. We did not have any such code, I have no clue how they ever expected us to get it. The note also had a phone number to call in case we needed any more assistance. The phone number was wrong, so we kept calling an old lady in the middle of the night. Finally we called all numbers we had at hand and someone answered. She gave us the code and by 1:30am, we got to our room. The room looks like it has not been remodeled since my grandpa's time. But it is very clean. My main problem was that it was really hot and there is no AC, they left us some tiny noisy fan that sort of helped. The second major problem is that is not close to anything you want to see in Berlin. It is in an area where every restaurant and store is middle eastern or Turkish, and so are the residents. This means you can find cheap food close by, but it was not much of a German experience. The metro is also not close, you need to take the bus in either direction to get to a metro and then stay in the metro for a while in order to get to any of the attractions. They claim they are close to everything, they really are not. Because of this, we were a bit apprehensive to go out at night and not make it back before the public transportation closed. I have no clue how much a taxi is from the center of Berlin all the way out to this hotel, but I will guess it is not cheap. Other than the location, and the room decor, I would say it is ok. The staff is nice, it is clean, and the breakfast is acceptable. If you are flying out of Tegel, it is quite close, but Schoenfeld airport is quite far. I do not plan on staying here again when we return to Berlin, I think I can find something closer to the attractions for about the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was overbooked, but good solution”
Reviews.Author: AmsterdamSquirrel
Reviews.Content: During the ITB Exhibition I tried to stay at the Alfa Hotel. Yes, tried, because the hotel was overbooked. Although I had a guaranteed reservation, the hotel told me I had to go to the Angleterre Hotel. The Alfa Hotel paid the taxi and the Angleterre is a better and nicer hotel than Hotel Alfa. So I didn't had much to complain!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel close to Public Transport”
Reviews.Author: davetheboss
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights at the start of November. Weather was fine and not too cold. Room was very good the only slight disappointment was the breakfast but we got enough to do us. As a previous writer we used the M27 bus which took us to and from Turmstr Underground (5min) The buses run every 5-10 min and then use the underground to get to wherever. As you come out of the hotel Turmstr station is to the left and Mierendorfplatz station is to the right. Bus M27 runs between them both. Bus stops in either direction are just a few yards from the hotel door.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, especially if you are not afraid of walking!”
Reviews.Author: fromliverpool
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel, spacious rooms, very good breakfast. Weather was excellent during our stay so the walk to Brandenburg Gate, which took an hour, was very pleasant - half of it through the park and, because public transport is so good, it is amazingly traffic free for a capital city. It is a brisk 20 minute walk to Turmstrasse underground station, slightly less to Mierendorfplatz. We didn't use the bus, but there looked to be plenty close by. Schloss Charlottenberg is within easy walking distance from the hotel. We chose the hotel to be away from the hustle, bustle and noise, but still experienced some traffic noise early on Monday morning. Altogether an excellent stay, I just wonder if we would have found it a bit far out if it the weather had been bad?

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Quality and Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Alfa is a comfortable and good 4 star hotel. The staff are friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet is good and caters for all from eggs to ceral. Rooms are quiet, clean and really good size with a little balcony overlooking a little garden below. The only drawback is that it is a 10 min bus ride not a walk from stations Mierendorfplatz and Turmstr. To walk would take 25min. There is however a TXL bus (10 min walk toward Turmstr) which runs to most of your tourist haunts, last stop Alexanderplatz which is what we used all week.

HotelInfo.Name: Alfa Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Ufnaustrasse 1, 10553 Berlin, Germany
